original_title: Brooklyn: Coney Island Avenue - Neck Road
text:
(1) 2541 Coney Island Ave., east side, near Neck Road, showing the home of John Friend, built by him in 1853. This house was used in 1877 or thereabouts as a roadhouse. Coney Island Plank Road, now Coney Island Ave., was opened about the same time.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2) The same, showing the wagon-smith shop of Augustus F. Friend erected in 1877, in the rear of his father's home.

1922.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Coney Island Avenue - Neck Road
text:
(1)
2541 Coney Island Ave., east side, near Neck Road, showing the home of John Friend, later occupied by Augustus Friend. It was at one time known as the Grand Central Hotel.
April 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(2)
The same, showing the north side of the house.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

(3)
The same, showing also a section of a gasoline station to the south of the house.
October 1928.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

original_title: Brooklyn: Coney Island Avenue - Neck Road
text:
(1) 2541 Coney Island Ave., east side, near the N.E. corner of Neck Road. A view of Augustus Friend's House.

April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) same, from another angle.

April 21, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.
